background: Subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) prediction of droughts and floods is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction. Recent studies suggest that the springtime land surface temperature/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) over the Tibetan Plateau (TP) can be a new source of S2S predictability. The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Sea surface temperature (SST) variations such as those associated with the Madden-Julian Oscillations are known to provide a predictability source. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.

The background temperature gradient at midlatitudes also affects the activity of baroclinic eddies (Xue et al., 2023), which can further reinforce the zonal wind changes and further influence the zonal wind downstream as the eddies move downstream and interact with the zonal flow. The response of the zonal wind in the downstream of TP is consistent with these studies, exhibiting a significant deceleration of the zonal wind along the jet core over the North Pacific. Meanwhile, a significant acceleration of the zonal wind is found to the north of the jet core, indicating a slight northward shift of the jet stream. Such changes in the zonal wind have their counterparts in the observations (see Fig. 4b). One salient feature in Fig. 5a is the strong negative geopotential height anomaly over the TP at 200 hPa, accompanied with a cyclonic anomalous circulation. Such a circulation response corresponds to the cold anomaly over the TP, where the atmosphere sinks and induces negative potential height anomalies at upper levels. Furthermore, evident wave-like patterns downstream from the TP to the North Pacific are shown in the geopotential height difference in Fig. 5a. The negative center of geopotential height anomaly over the TP extends eastward to Japan, while a strong positive geopotential height center with anticyclonic circulation flow emerges to the east over the Bering Strait with a center around 170°E, 50°N. The wave-like geopotential height differences further extend from the Rocky Mountain across the North American continent, North Atlantic Ocean, and back to the Eurasian continent. The above simulated response in atmospheric circulations is in general consistent with the observed geopotential height anomalies in May 2003 (Fig. 5b). In addition, responses in the geopotential height to the cold TP surface are also noticed in the Southern Hemisphere, especially in the midlatitudes (Fig. 5a, b). Therefore, we also inspect the anomalous stream function from the simulated wind. The WAF is parallel to the group velocity of Rossby waves and can approximately indicate the wave energy propagation.

Although the teleconnections caused by the heating due to oceanic temperature anomalies, such as those between ENSO and the Asian monsoons, have been extensively investigated (e.g., Wang et al. 2000; Li et al. 2007; Li et al. 2017), the remote effects of mountain heating on global atmospheric circulations have not been fully studied. The LS4P-I experiment provides a chance to explore the detailed features of the TRC wave train as well as the global response of atmospheric circulations to the TP surface anomaly. It is well known and extensively studied that the TP surface thermal state can significantly influence the weather and climate in East Asia (e.g. Liu et al. 2020). Earlier studies have shown that, in summertime, there exists a circumglobal teleconnection pattern (CTP) in the extra-tropics of the Northern Hemisphere along the westerly jet. The latent heat with the strong convective monsoon precipitation is suggested a major driver for the CTP (e.g. Lau and Peng 1991; Lau and Weng 2002; Lau et al. 2004 ; Ding and Wang 2005; Ding et al. 2011).
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment. More dynamical understanding of the TRC wave train as well as its cross-equator propagation into the Southern Hemisphere will be explored in the newly launched LS4P phase II experiment.

This study has investigated the mechanisms of the global atmospheric response to the TP spring LST/SUBT anomalies in simulations by LS4P-I ESMs. To further explore the TP’s role and the influence of TRC wave train in S2S predictions, we check the response simulated by each model in May. These results taken together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations.
Our aim is to place the TP LST/SUBT’s influence on the global atmospheric circulations with a focus on the dynamical feature of the TRC wave train and its importance for improving S2S prediction.

However, over the regions from the North Atlantic to the Ural Mountains, the observed geopotential height anomalies show opposite signs to the multi-model average, suggesting that in those regions the TP surface cooling may not be the major cause for the observed circulation anomalies. The main difference is that the simulated atmospheric response in model ensemble evolve faster than the observation. The associated diversities in the model response in the Southern Hemispheric circulations could be one of the main reasons that the simulated response exhibit great inconsistency with the observation, though the model ensembles show strong Southern Hemispheric responses especially in the mid-high latitudes.

Compared with the observation, none of the LS4P-I ESMs well captures the observed T2m cold anomaly in May 2003. The ensemble mean of the 16 LS4P-I ESMs exhibits a warm bias of 1.02 °C over the TP, which is stronger than the standard deviation of the observed inter-annual variation of TP T2m (about 0.7 °C). The spatial distribution of the model bias for the ensemble mean is shown in Fig. 1b, which shows a clear warm bias in May 2003 T2m over the eastern part of the TP. The LS4P-I simulations further show that the TP surface thermal state not only has circumglobal influence in the Northern Hemisphere, but it also affects the extratropical atmospheric circulation in the Southern Hemisphere, though with a large uncertainty due to inter-model variability.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The ensemble mean of simulated 200 hPa geopotential height difference is also illustrated in Fig. 5a together with the observations for May 2003 (Fig. 5b), to further explore the atmospheric circulation responses to the TP LST/SUBT effect.

The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. All data are provided at 0.5° × 0.5° spatial resolution. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis (Harris et al. 2014; 2020).
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. The TRC wave train modulated by the TP thermal anomaly play a critical role on the early summer surface air temperature and precipitation anomalies in the regions along the wave train, especially over the northwest North America and the southern Great Plains. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned.

These results taking together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations. The ensemble model simulations show that, with the strong westerly jet across the extratropical Asian-Pacific region, the TP surface cooling generates a barotropic, persistent (evolving in time scales longer than a month) TRC wave train from TP through northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the west part of the North America, whose features closely resemble the observed geopotential height anomaly from May to June in 2003.

The key features of the simulated ensemble mean of June precipitation in response to the TP LST/SUBT effect were discussed in Xue et al. (2022). The LS4P-I experiment, however, shows that the TP surface anomaly can result in persistent and global scale anomalies in atmospheric circulations, and has a near-global influence on the summer T2m and precipitation on S2S time scale. Furthermore, the LS4P-I experiment confirms and highlights the important even critical role of the TRC wave train in the global influence of the TP surface anomaly. The analysis of 16 state-of-the-art ESMs shows for the first time that the springtime TP surface anomaly can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic TRC wave train.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）预测干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的主要挑战之一。最近的研究表明，春季青藏高原（TP）的地表温度/地下温度（LST/SUBT）可以成为S2S预测的新来源。成功预测亚季节到季节（S2S）时间尺度上的干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的一大挑战，预测失败可能对社会和经济造成重大不利影响。海表温度（SST）变化，如与马登-朱利安振荡相关的变化，已知提供了预测的来源。最近的研究表明，春季地表/地下温度（LST/SUBT）在S2S时间尺度上提供了新的可预测性来源。全球能源与水文交换（GEWEX）计划已启动“初始化地表温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测影响（LS4P）”项目，以研究春季LST/SUBT异常对夏季降水预测的影响。

中纬度的背景温度梯度也影响了斜压涡旋的活动（Xue et al., 2023），这进一步增强了纬向风的变化，并在涡旋向下游移动并与纬向流相互作用时进一步影响下游的纬向风。青藏 Plateau（TP）下游的纬向风响应与这些研究一致，表现为北太平洋喷流核心沿线的纬向风显著减速。同时，在喷流核心以北发现纬向风显著加速，表明喷流略微向北偏移。这种纬向风的变化在观测中也有对应（见图4b）。图5a中的一个显著特征是TP上方200 hPa的强负位势高度异常，伴随着气旋异常环流。这种环流响应对应于TP上的冷异常，导致大气下沉并在上层诱发负位势高度异常。此外，从TP向北太平洋下游明显显示出波状模式的位势高度差（见图5a）。TP上方的负位势高度异常中心向东延伸至日本，而在白令海峡以东则出现强正位势高度中心及反气旋环流，中心位于约170°E，50°N。波状位势高度差进一步从落基山脉延伸穿过北美大陆、北大西洋，回到欧亚大陆。上述模拟的气候环流响应总体上与2003年5月的观测位势高度异常一致（见图5b）。此外，在南半球，尤其是在中纬度地区，也注意到对冷TP表面的位势高度响应（见图5a, b）。因此，我们还检查了从模拟风场得到的异常流函数。波动能量通量（WAF）与罗斯贝波的群速度平行，可以大致指示波能量的传播。

尽管由于海洋温度异常引起的热带遥相关（teleconnections），例如ENSO与亚洲季风之间的关系，已经得到了广泛研究（例如，Wang等，2000；Li等，2007；Li等，2017），但山地加热对全球大气环流的远程影响尚未得到充分研究。LS4P-I实验为探索热带高原（TP）表面异常的TRC波列特征以及大气环流的全球响应提供了机会。众所周知，TP表面的热状态可以显著影响东亚的天气和气候（例如，Liu等，2020）。早期研究表明，在夏季，北半球的副热带地区沿着西风急流存在一种环全球遥相关模式（CTP）。强对流季风降水中的潜热被认为是CTP的主要驱动因素（例如，Lau和Peng 1991；Lau和Weng 2002；Lau等，2004；Ding和Wang 2005；Ding等，2011）。
research objectiveCn: 项目“初始化陆面温度和雪盖对季节内到季节预测的影响（LS4P）”旨在研究春季陆面温度/雪盖异常对高山地区夏季降水预测的影响。目前的工作探讨了16个参与LS4P第一阶段（LS4P-I）实验的当前先进地球系统模型（ESMs）对春季天山地区陆面降温的全球尺度大气环流响应的模拟。对热带环流波列及其向南半球的跨赤道传播的动态理解将在新启动的LS4P第二阶段实验中进行深入探讨。
本研究调查了LS4P-I ESMs模拟中全球大气对青藏 Plateau（TP）春季地表温度/地下温度异常的响应机制。为了进一步探讨TP的作用及热带环流（TRC）波列在短期到季节预测中的影响，我们检查了每个模型在五月的响应。这些结果表明，TRC波列在TP的地表和地下温度对热点区域的影响中发挥了关键作用，特别是在北美地区，尽管TRC波列如何影响这些不同区域降水的详细机制仍需进一步研究。
我们的目标是将热带低频波动（TP LST/SUBT）对全球大气环流的影响与热带环流波列（TRC wave train）的动力特征结合起来，重点关注其在改善季节到季节预测（S2S）中的重要性。
challengesCn: 然而，从热带地区传播到南半球的模拟传播路径显示出较大的模型间差异。
然而，模拟的波列与观测之间存在相位差异。然而，从北大西洋到乌拉尔山脉的区域，观测到的地势高度异常与多模型平均值呈现相反的符号，这表明在这些区域，地表冷却可能不是观测到的环流异常的主要原因。主要的区别在于，模型集合中模拟的大气响应演变速度快于观测。南半球环流中模型响应的多样性可能是模拟响应与观测之间存在巨大不一致的主要原因之一，尽管模型集合在南半球中高纬度地区显示出强烈的响应。

与观测相比，LS4P-I的气候模型（ESMs）都未能很好地捕捉到2003年5月的T2m冷异常。16个LS4P-I气候模型的集合均值在青藏 Plateau（TP）上表现出1.02°C的暖偏差，这一偏差强于TP T2m观测的年际变化标准差（约0.7°C）。模型集合均值的偏差空间分布如图1b所示，显示出2003年5月TP东部地区T2m的明显暖偏差。LS4P-I模拟进一步表明，TP的表面热状态不仅对北半球具有全球影响，还影响南半球的温带大气环流，尽管由于模型间的变异性，这一影响存在较大不确定性。
methodsCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段（LS4P-I）中，2003年是重点案例，该年东亚经历了极端的夏季干旱/洪水，春季在青藏 Plateau（TP）则经历了非常寒冷的天气。LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常的全球影响。第一组实验称为EXP_CTRL，旨在评估16个地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟2003年5月和6月TP气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。在EXP_CTRL实验中，ESMs从4月底或5月1日开始模拟，并使用标准的季节到季节（S2S）预测设置的气候和陆地初始条件。另一组数值实验则由ESMs进行，以测试6月降水的区域偏差是否与5月TP表面温度的偏差相关。在这一组实验中，统称为EXP_LST/SUBT运行，通过初始化TP的陆地表面温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件，减少模型在5月TP气温上的偏差。
datasetCn: 模拟的200 hPa位势高度差的集合均值在图5a中展示，同时与2003年5月的观测结果（图5b）一起，进一步探讨了大气环流对青藏 Plateau（TP）地表温度/土壤湿度效应的响应。

在图1a中显示了青藏高原（TP）观察到的T2m异常，我们使用来自美国国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS，Fan和van den Dool 2008）的数据。我们使用第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心大气再分析（ERA5，Hersbach等，2020），该数据被称为观测数据，具有1.0° × 1.0°的常规水平分辨率，以研究2003年的大气环流以及气候学，后者定义为1981年至2015年的平均值。所有数据均以0.5° × 0.5°的空间分辨率提供。全球降水数据来自气候研究单位（CRU），在实施分析时使用版本4.02（Harris等，2014；2020）。
findingsCn: LS4P-I结果首次表明，春季的表层温度异常可以通过青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球波列（TRC）从青藏 Plateau 调制，经过东北亚和白令海峡到达北美西部，同时影响春季的西风急流。这种由青藏 Plateau 热异常调制的 TRC 波列在早夏的表面气温和降水异常中发挥了关键作用，尤其是在北美西北部和南部大平原地区。这些结果表明，青藏 Plateau 的陆地表面温度/土壤湿度异常通过 TRC 波列是上述地区季节到季节变率的主要来源。

这些结果综合表明，青藏 Plateau（TP）的波列在影响TP表面和地下温度对热点区域的影响中发挥了关键作用，特别是在北美地区，尽管TRC波列影响这些不同区域降水的详细机制仍需进一步研究。集合模型模拟显示，在强西风急流穿越亚太地区的情况下，TP表面降温会产生一个从TP通过东北亚和白令海峡延伸到北美西部的条带性、持久性（演变时间尺度超过一个月）的TRC波列，其特征与2003年5月至6月观察到的地势高度异常非常相似。

Xue等人（2022）讨论了响应于青藏 Plateau（TP）地表温度/土壤湿度效应的6月降水模拟集合均值的关键特征。然而，LS4P-I实验表明，TP表面异常可以导致大气环流的持续和全球尺度异常，并对S2S时间尺度上的夏季2米气温和降水产生近全球影响。此外，LS4P-I实验确认并强调了热带环流（TRC）波列在TP表面异常全球影响中的重要甚至关键作用。对16个先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）的分析首次表明，春季TP表面异常可以调节持续的准气柱TRC波列。

background: Subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) precipitation prediction in boreal spring and summer months, despite including large number of high-impact events, such as droughts/floods, has remained poor for years. Tibetan Plateau (TP) spring observed surface temperatures show a lag correlation with summer precipitation in several remote regions, but current global land–atmosphere coupled models are unable to represent this behavior due to significant errors in producing observed TP surface temperatures. The land’s role in the climate system at various scales has been the subject of much research since the 1970s. A few land surface attributes, such as albedo, soil moisture, leaf area index, vegetation, and aerosols in snow have been extensively investigated to explore their roles in land–atmosphere interactions. Ocean state is well known to play a major role in modulating Earth’s climate. The linkage of hydrological events to sea surface temperature (SST) anomalies, such as El Niño and La Niña, has been used to predict climate events with useful skill at long lead times ranging from a few months to a few years. However, studies have also consistently shown that the SST only partially explains climate predictability. Recent preliminary studies based on observational data and modeling have indicated that spring land temperature in the Rocky Mountains and the Tibetan Plateau (TP) could affect summer drought/flood in their respective downstream regions with a magnitude comparable to the SST effect and atmospheric internal variability. Although land surface 2-m air temperature (T2m) measurements have the best quality and longest record among various land surface variables with global coverage, their application in land–atmosphere interaction studies, S2S prediction in particular, has largely been overlooked.
research objective: To address these issues, the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program launched the “Impact of Initialized Land Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal-to-Seasonal Prediction” (LS4P) initiative as a community effort to test the impact of land temperature in high-mountain regions on S2S prediction by climate models. This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here. The LS4P objective is to examine whether the observed cold May 2003 TP anomaly causes the observed remote June precipitation anomalies over hotspots worldwide.
challenges: Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical to this effort yet remain scientifically challenging. Most studies of land–atmosphere interactions have been limited by a lack of observational data and tend to focus on local feedbacks. Current state-of-the-art ESMs are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized LST anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. There are two issues that need further investigation: 1) The ensemble-mean-produced T2m difference is smaller than the observed anomaly. Would this deficiency cause an underestimation of the TP T2m effect? 2) In some areas, the ensemble mean produces a significant June precipitation difference, such as in western Australia and western Europe, but with the opposite sign compared to the observation. Is this due to a model deficiency in its ability to produce the full TP T2m anomaly and/or correct precipitation anomaly, and/or some other processes involved?
methods: In this study, observed T2m records are used to examine possible relationships between the TP T2m and global precipitation and to identify the locations (hotspots) where the initialization of TP May land temperatures may enhance June precipitation prediction skill. Two pairs of experiments with 16 state-of-the-art LS4P ESMs (Table ES1) have been conducted. In the first experiment (referred to as control run), we evaluate whether the ESMs can properly produce the observed TP T2m anomaly in May 2003 and the June precipitation anomaly. To alleviate the ESMs’ May TP T2m bias and to generate the observed cold TP spring anomaly, we introduce an innovative approach to initializing the LST/SUBT over the TP. After adjusting the LST/SUBT initial conditions based on each model’s T2m bias and observed anomaly over the TP, a second experiment (referred to as the sensitivity run) is conducted using the new LST/SUBT initial condition for each model over the TP, with all other initial and boundary conditions and ensemble members identical to the first experiment.
dataset: In this study, the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) T2m data, which consist in 80 stations over the TP and more than 2,400 stations over all of China, are used over China. The Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) T2m data are used elsewhere. The Climate Research Unit (CRU) data are used for precipitation over globe.
findings: This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here; the ensemble means in some “hotspots” produce more than 40% of the observed anomalies. Consistent results from observations and multiple ESM experiments show that improving the May TP land temperature simulation through LST/SUBT initialization over the TP allows ESMs to better predict June precipitation over hotspots, and that the LST over high-mountain areas could be a new source of S2S predictability through elevated heating.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）降水预测在北半球春季和夏季月份中，尽管包括大量高影响事件，如干旱和洪水，但多年来预测效果依然较差。青藏 Plateau（TP）春季观测的地表温度与多个远程地区的夏季降水之间存在滞后相关性，但当前的全球陆气耦合模型由于在产生观测到的TP地表温度方面存在显著误差，无法表现出这种行为。自1970年代以来，土地在气候系统中不同尺度的作用一直是许多研究的主题。一些土地表面属性，如反照率、土壤湿度、叶面积指数、植被和雪中的气溶胶，已被广泛研究以探索它们在陆气相互作用中的作用。海洋状态被广泛认为在调节地球气候中发挥着重要作用。水文事件与海表温度（SST）异常之间的联系，如厄尔尼诺和拉尼娜，已被用于预测气候事件，并在几个月到几年范围内提供有用的技能。然而，研究也一致表明，SST仅部分解释气候可预测性。基于观测数据和建模的近期初步研究表明，落基山脉和青藏高原（TP）的春季地面温度可能会影响各自下游地区的夏季干旱/洪水，其影响程度与SST效应和大气内部变率相当。尽管地表2米气温（T2m）测量在各种地表变量中具有最佳质量和最长记录，并且具有全球覆盖，但在陆气相互作用研究中，特别是在S2S预测中，其应用在很大程度上被忽视。
research objectiveCn: 为了解决这些问题，全球能源与水交换（GEWEX）计划启动了“初始化的陆地温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测的影响”（LS4P）倡议，作为一项社区努力，测试高山地区的陆地温度对气候模型的S2S预测的影响。这项研究首次揭示，高山陆地温度可能是S2S降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”地区的海洋表面温度相当。LS4P的目标是研究2003年5月观察到的青藏高原冷异常是否导致了全球热点地区6月降水异常的出现。
challengesCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置对这一努力至关重要，但仍然具有科学挑战性。大多数关于陆地-大气相互作用的研究受到观测数据不足的限制，往往集中于局部反馈。目前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的地表温度（LST）异常的记忆，这主要是由于模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据存在缺陷。有两个问题需要进一步研究：1）集合均值产生的2米气温（T2m）差异小于观测异常。这一缺陷是否会导致对热带气旋（TP）T2m效应的低估？2）在某些地区，集合均值产生了显著的6月降水差异，例如在澳大利亚西部和西欧，但与观测结果的符号相反。这是由于模型在产生完整的TP T2m异常和/或正确的降水异常方面的缺陷，还是由于其他相关过程？
methodsCn: 在这项研究中，观察到的T2m记录用于检查TP T2m与全球降水之间的可能关系，并识别出初始化TP 5月地面温度可能增强6月降水预测技能的位置（热点）。进行了两组实验，使用16个最先进的LS4P ESMs（见表ES1）。在第一个实验（称为控制运行）中，我们评估ESMs是否能够正确产生2003年5月的TP T2m异常和6月的降水异常。为了减轻ESMs在5月TP T2m上的偏差，并生成观察到的寒冷TP春季异常，我们引入了一种创新的方法来初始化TP的LST/SUBT。在根据每个模型的T2m偏差和TP的观察异常调整LST/SUBT初始条件后，进行了第二个实验（称为敏感性运行），该实验使用新的TP LST/SUBT初始条件，所有其他初始和边界条件以及集合成员与第一个实验相同。
datasetCn: 在本研究中，使用了中国气象局（CMA）的T2m数据，该数据涵盖了青藏高原的80个站点和中国境内超过2400个站点。气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的T2m数据用于其他地区。气候研究单位（CRU）的数据用于全球降水。
findingsCn: 这项研究首次揭示，高山地区的地面温度可能是季节到季节（S2S）降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”区域的海洋表面温度相当；在一些“热点”区域，集合均值产生的观测异常超过40%。来自观测和多种地球系统模型（ESM）实验的一致结果表明，通过对青藏 Plateau（TP）地区的地面温度进行LST/SUBT初始化，可以改善5月TP地区的地面温度模拟，从而使ESM更好地预测6月在热点地区的降水，并且高山地区的地面温度可能成为通过升高加热提供S2S可预测性的一个新来源。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a method used to assess the influence of land surface temperature anomalies on subseasonal to seasonal precipitation prediction?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于评估地表温度异常对亚季节到季节降水预测影响的方法的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: One method involves using 16 state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) to simulate the global atmospheric response to springtime land surface temperature anomalies over the Tibetan Plateau. This includes initializing land surface temperature and subsurface temperature conditions to evaluate changes in atmospheric circulation and precipitation patterns.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种方法是使用16个先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）来模拟全球大气对青藏高原春季地表温度异常的响应。这包括初始化地表温度和地下温度条件，以评估大气环流和降水模式的变化。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a dataset utilized for analyzing the global atmospheric response to high-mountain land temperature anomalies?
Example.QuestionCn: 一个用于分析高山地区温度异常对全球大气反应的数据集的例子是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a dataset used in this analysis is the Climate Research Unit (CRU) data for global precipitation, along with the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5) for atmospheric circulation studies.
Example.AnswerCn: 本分析中使用的一个数据集是全球降水的气候研究单位（CRU）数据，以及用于大气环流研究的第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心大气再分析（ERA5）。

Example.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise from using ensemble model simulations to study the impact of Tibetan Plateau surface anomalies on global atmospheric circulations, and how are these addressed?
Example.QuestionCn: 使用集合模型模拟研究青藏高原表面异常对全球大气环流影响时可能出现哪些挑战，以及如何应对这些挑战？
Example.AnswerEn: Challenges include discrepancies between model simulations and observations, such as phase differences in wave trains or inability to capture certain anomalies. These are addressed by adjusting initial conditions for land surface temperature and subsurface temperature, and conducting sensitivity experiments to better align model outputs with observed data.
Example.AnswerCn: 挑战包括模型模拟与观测之间的差异，例如波列的相位差或无法捕捉某些异常现象。通过调整地表温度和地下温度的初始条件，以及进行敏感性实验来更好地使模型输出与观测数据对齐，从而解决这些问题。

Definition.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with using 'observed T2m records' for examining land-atmosphere interactions?
Definition.QuestionCn: 使用“观测到的T2m记录”来研究陆气相互作用面临哪些挑战？
Definition.AnswerEn: Using observed T2m (2-m air temperature) records to examine land-atmosphere interactions presents challenges such as the potential bias in temperature measurements, limited observational data in certain regions, and the difficulty of accurately representing these interactions in climate models. These issues can affect the reliability of predictions and the ability to capture the full influence of land temperature anomalies on precipitation patterns.
Definition.AnswerCn: 使用观测的2米空气温度（T2m）记录来研究陆地-大气相互作用面临一些挑战，例如温度测量的潜在偏差、某些地区观测数据的有限性，以及在气候模型中准确表示这些相互作用的困难。这些问题可能影响预测的可靠性，并影响捕捉陆地温度异常对降水模式的全面影响。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for land surface temperature in high-mountain regions compare to those used for sea surface temperature anomalies in terms of accuracy and challenges?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 高山地区的地表温度数据收集方法与海表温度异常的数据收集方法在准确性和挑战方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Land surface temperature data collection in high-mountain regions, such as the Tibetan Plateau, faces challenges due to model parameterization deficiencies and limited observational data, whereas sea surface temperature anomalies are better understood and have been widely used for climate predictability. The land's role in climate predictability is being explored for its potential, comparable to that of ocean surface temperature, especially in the context of S2S predictions.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 高山地区（如青藏 Plateau）的地表温度数据收集面临着模型参数化不足和观测数据有限的挑战，而海表温度异常则更易于理解，并已广泛用于气候可预测性研究。陆地在气候可预测性中的作用正在被探索，其潜力与海洋表面温度相当，特别是在季节到季节的预测（S2S）背景下。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the initialization of land surface temperature and subsurface temperature conditions improve subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models in high mountain regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 如何初始化地表温度和地下温度条件可以改善高山地区的亚季节到季节预测模型？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The initialization of land surface temperature (LST) and subsurface temperature (SUBT) conditions can improve subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models by reducing biases in current Earth System Models (ESMs). This approach allows for better simulation of observed anomalies, such as the cold Tibetan Plateau (TP) spring anomaly, which in turn enhances the prediction skill of summer precipitation in global hotspot regions. By refining the initial conditions based on observed data and model biases, the models can better capture the influence of high-mountain land temperatures on atmospheric circulations and precipitation patterns.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 土地表面温度（LST）和地下温度（SUBT）条件的初始化可以通过减少当前地球系统模型（ESMs）的偏差来改善亚季节到季节的预测模型。这种方法允许更好地模拟观察到的异常现象，例如寒冷的青藏高原（TP）春季异常，从而增强全球热点地区夏季降水的预测能力。通过基于观测数据和模型偏差来细化初始条件，模型能够更好地捕捉高山土地温度对大气环流和降水模式的影响。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What role do high-mountain land temperatures play in the predictability of global precipitation patterns, and how is this assessed in current research approaches?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 高山地区的土地温度在全球降水模式的可预测性中扮演着什么角色，目前的研究方法是如何评估这一点的？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: High-mountain land temperatures, particularly in regions like the Tibetan Plateau, are considered a substantial source of subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation predictability, potentially rivaling the influence of ocean surface temperatures. This is assessed through experiments using Earth System Models where the initialization of LST/SUBT is adjusted to reflect observed anomalies. These models are then evaluated for their ability to predict precipitation anomalies in identified global hotspots, demonstrating that improved land temperature simulations can significantly enhance predictive skill.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 高山地区的地表温度，特别是在像青藏高原这样的地区，被认为是亚季节到季节降水可预测性的一个重要来源，可能与海洋表面温度的影响相媲美。这是通过使用地球系统模型进行实验来评估的，其中调整了地表温度/土壤温度的初始化，以反映观察到的异常。这些模型随后被评估其在识别的全球热点中预测降水异常的能力，结果表明，改善地表温度模拟可以显著提高预测技能。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes challenges in preserving the memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies in Earth System Models for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致在地球系统模型中保存初始化地表温度异常记忆的挑战，影响亚季节到季节预测的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Current state-of-the-art Earth System Models are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 当前最先进的地球系统模型无法完全保留初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆，这主要是由于模型参数化的缺陷以及提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据的问题。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the reasons behind the persistent warm bias identified in model simulations over the Tibetan Plateau during May 2003?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在2003年5月的模型模拟中，青藏 Plateau 上识别出的持续温暖偏差的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The persistent warm bias in model simulations over the Tibetan Plateau during May 2003 is attributed to the ensemble mean of the models exhibiting a warm bias stronger than the standard deviation of the observed inter-annual variation, which indicates issues with capturing the observed temperature anomalies accurately.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在2003年5月，模型模拟中对青藏高原的持续暖偏差被归因于模型的集合均值表现出比观测到的年际变化标准差更强的暖偏差，这表明在准确捕捉观测温度异常方面存在问题。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of using observed 2-m air temperature (T2m) data from various sources, like the Climate Anomaly Monitoring System, on the evaluation of land-atmosphere interaction models?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用来自不同来源（如气候异常监测系统）的观测2米空气温度（T2m）数据对土地-大气相互作用模型的评估会产生什么后果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using observed T2m data from sources like the Climate Anomaly Monitoring System can provide a robust basis for evaluating land-atmosphere interaction models. This data aids in assessing model performance in simulating temperature anomalies and helps identify model biases, ultimately contributing to improved model initialization and enhanced prediction skill for events like droughts and floods.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用气候异常监测系统等来源的观测T2m数据，可以为评估陆气相互作用模型提供坚实的基础。这些数据有助于评估模型在模拟温度异常方面的表现，并帮助识别模型偏差，最终有助于改善模型初始化和增强对干旱和洪水等事件的预测能力。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the primary objectives behind the LS4P initiative when examining the impact of land temperature and snowpack on subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: LS4P倡议在研究土地温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测的影响时，其主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objectives behind the LS4P initiative are to investigate the impact of land temperature in high-mountain regions on subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) prediction by climate models, and to examine whether the observed cold May 2003 Tibetan Plateau anomaly causes the remote June precipitation anomalies over hotspots worldwide. This study aims to reveal that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, potentially comparable in effect to ocean surface temperature.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: LS4P倡议的主要目标是研究高山地区的土地温度对气候模型的亚季节到季节（S2S）预测的影响，并考察2003年5月观察到的青藏高原冷异常是否导致全球热点地区6月降水异常。该研究旨在揭示高山土地温度可能是S2S降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与海洋表面温度相当。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it critical to address model configuration and land initialization in the context of land-atmosphere interaction studies for S2S prediction?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在S2S预测的陆气相互作用研究中，解决模型配置和土地初始化问题至关重要。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical because current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) have deficiencies in preserving the memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies. This is due to inadequacies in model parameterizations and unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions from reanalysis data. Addressing these issues is essential for improving the accuracy of S2S predictions and understanding the land's role in climate predictability.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置至关重要，因为当前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）在保持初始化的地表温度异常记忆方面存在缺陷。这是由于模型参数化不足以及来自再分析数据的初始大气/陆地条件不平衡所致。解决这些问题对于提高季节到季节（S2S）预测的准确性和理解土地在气候可预测性中的作用至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the goal of employing an innovative approach to initializing land surface and subsurface temperatures in climate models for the LS4P project?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在LS4P项目中，采用创新方法初始化地表和地下温度的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal of employing an innovative approach to initializing land surface and subsurface temperatures in climate models for the LS4P project is to alleviate the Earth System Models' May Tibetan Plateau temperature bias and to generate the observed cold spring anomaly. By adjusting these initial conditions, the project aims to enhance the models' ability to predict June precipitation over identified hotspots and improve the understanding of land temperature's role in S2S predictability.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 在LS4P项目中，采用创新的方法初始化地表和地下温度的目标是缓解地球系统模型在五月份对青藏 Plateau 的温度偏差，并生成观察到的寒冷春季异常。通过调整这些初始条件，该项目旨在增强模型对识别热点地区六月份降水的预测能力，并改善对土地温度在季节到季节预测中的作用的理解。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are involved in initializing land surface temperature and subsurface temperature over high mountain areas to improve subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高山地区初始化地表温度和地下温度以改善亚季节到季节预测涉及哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The initialization of land surface temperature and subsurface temperature over high mountain areas involves adjusting the initial conditions based on each model's temperature bias and observed anomaly. This is done to alleviate the model's bias and generate the observed cold spring anomaly, particularly in the Tibetan Plateau. This approach is used in sensitivity experiments where the land surface and subsurface temperature initial conditions are modified while keeping other initial and boundary conditions constant.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 高山地区的地表温度和地下温度的初始化涉及根据每个模型的温度偏差和观测异常来调整初始条件。这是为了减轻模型的偏差，并生成观测到的寒冷春季异常，特别是在青藏高原。这种方法用于敏感性实验中，在修改地表和地下温度初始条件的同时保持其他初始和边界条件不变。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the steps involved in using observed temperature records to enhance global precipitation prediction skills in climate models?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn:
使用观测温度记录来增强气候模型中全球降水预测技能的步骤包括：

1. 收集和整理观测温度数据。
2. 分析温度与降水之间的关系。
3. 将观测温度数据整合到气候模型中。
4. 调整模型参数以提高降水预测的准确性。
5. 进行模型验证，比较预测结果与实际降水记录。
6. 迭代优化模型，基于验证结果进行调整。
7. 应用改进后的模型进行未来降水预测。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To enhance global precipitation prediction skills using observed temperature records, the process involves examining relationships between land surface temperatures and global precipitation patterns. This includes identifying hotspot regions where land temperature initialization can improve prediction skill. Observed temperature records are used to adjust model biases, and experiments are conducted to compare control runs with adjusted sensitivity runs, focusing on the impact of land temperature initialization on precipitation prediction.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了提高全球降水预测技能，利用观测到的温度记录，过程涉及检查地表温度与全球降水模式之间的关系。这包括识别热点区域，在这些区域中，陆地温度初始化可以改善预测技能。使用观测到的温度记录来调整模型偏差，并进行实验以比较控制运行与调整敏感性运行，重点关注陆地温度初始化对降水预测的影响。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data collection methods enable the accurate initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack conditions in high-mountain regions for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据收集方法能够准确初始化高山地区的地表温度和雪盖条件，以用于亚季节到季节的预测模型？
Enablement.AnswerEn: In the field of subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction, accurate initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack conditions in high-mountain regions is enabled by the use of observed T2m records, such as those from the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) and the Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS). These records are used to assess possible relationships between temperature and global precipitation and to identify hotspots where initialization can enhance prediction skills.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在亚季节到季节预测领域，通过使用来自中国气象局（CMA）和气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的观测2米温度（T2m）记录，可以准确初始化高山地区的地表温度和雪盖条件。这些记录用于评估温度与全球降水之间的可能关系，并识别出能够增强预测技能的初始化热点。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways does the integration of multiple Earth System Models (ESMs) enhance the understanding of subseasonal-to-seasonal variability related to land surface temperature anomalies?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 多种地球系统模型（ESMs）的整合如何增强对与地表温度异常相关的亚季节到季节变率的理解？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of multiple Earth System Models (ESMs) enhances the understanding of subseasonal-to-seasonal variability related to land surface temperature anomalies by providing diverse simulations that can capture the complex interactions between land surface temperature anomalies and atmospheric circulation. This approach allows for the identification of global atmospheric responses and the role of the TRC wave train in modulating precipitation patterns, thereby improving predictability.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 多个地球系统模型（ESMs）的整合增强了对与地表温度异常相关的亚季节到季节变率的理解，因为它提供了多样化的模拟，能够捕捉地表温度异常与大气环流之间的复杂相互作用。这种方法使得能够识别全球大气响应以及TRC波列在调节降水模式中的作用，从而提高可预测性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be large inter-model differences in the propagation pathways from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere when using different data collection methods?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在使用不同的数据收集方法时，从青藏高原向南半球的传播路径会存在较大的模型间差异？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The simulated propagation pathways from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere show large inter-model differences due to diversities in model responses in the Southern Hemispheric circulations. This could be attributed to deficiencies in model parameterizations and unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions provided by reanalysis data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 从青藏 Plateau 向南半球的模拟传播路径显示出较大的模型间差异，这主要是由于模型在南半球环流响应上的多样性。这可能归因于模型参数化的缺陷以及由再分析数据提供的不平衡初始大气/陆地条件。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why do current Earth System Models struggle to fully preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 当前的地球系统模型为何难以完全保留初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Current state-of-the-art Earth System Models are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. This results in an inability to accurately simulate the observed temperature anomalies.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 当前最先进的地球系统模型无法完全保留初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆，这主要是由于模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据存在缺陷。这导致无法准确模拟观察到的温度异常。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is there a warm bias in the ensemble mean of the LS4P-I Earth System Models when simulating Tibetan Plateau surface temperatures?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在模拟青藏高原表面温度时，LS4P-I地球系统模型的集合均值存在温暖偏差？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Compared with the observation, none of the LS4P-I Earth System Models well captures the observed T2m cold anomaly in May 2003. The ensemble mean of the models exhibits a warm bias of 1.02 °C over the Tibetan Plateau, which is stronger than the standard deviation of the observed inter-annual variation of TP T2m. This bias could be due to model deficiencies in representing the surface thermal state accurately.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 与观测相比，LS4P-I地球系统模型中没有一个能够很好地捕捉到2003年5月观测到的T2m冷异常。模型的集合均值在青藏高原上表现出1.02°C的暖偏差，这一偏差强于青藏高原T2m观测年际变化的标准差。这一偏差可能是由于模型在准确表示地表热状态方面存在缺陷。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges in collecting and utilizing global land-atmosphere coupled model data for studying the impact of land temperature on climate prediction?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 收集和利用全球陆气耦合模型数据以研究地面温度对气候预测影响的潜在挑战有哪些？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: A significant challenge in utilizing global land-atmosphere coupled model data lies in the inability of these models to accurately reproduce observed land surface temperatures, particularly over the Tibetan Plateau. This is due to model biases and deficiencies in representing land-atmosphere interactions and maintaining the memory of initialized temperature anomalies. Additionally, the lack of observational data to validate model outputs further complicates the process, as does the need for innovative initialization techniques to address these issues.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 利用全球陆气耦合模型数据的一大挑战在于，这些模型无法准确再现观察到的地表温度，特别是在青藏高原地区。这是由于模型偏差和在表征陆气相互作用及维持初始化温度异常记忆方面的不足。此外，缺乏观测数据来验证模型输出进一步复杂化了这一过程，同时也需要创新的初始化技术来解决这些问题。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your judgment, what data collection methods could be improved or developed to better understand the influence of land surface anomalies on global precipitation patterns?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在您看来，哪些数据收集方法可以改进或开发，以更好地理解地表异常对全球降水模式的影响？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Improving data collection methods could involve increasing the density and quality of observational networks, particularly in high-mountain regions like the Tibetan Plateau, to provide more accurate initial conditions for models. Additionally, developing innovative data assimilation techniques that better integrate land and atmosphere data could enhance the accuracy of predictions. Utilizing high-resolution reanalysis data and improving model parameterizations to better capture land-atmosphere feedback processes are also crucial steps in enhancing our understanding of land surface anomalies' influence on global precipitation.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 改善数据收集方法可以涉及增加观测网络的密度和质量，特别是在像青藏高原这样的高山地区，以提供更准确的模型初始条件。此外，开发创新的数据同化技术，更好地整合陆地和大气数据，可以提高预测的准确性。利用高分辨率再分析数据和改善模型参数化，以更好地捕捉陆地-大气反馈过程，也是增强我们对陆面异常对全球降水影响理解的关键步骤。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges involved in maintaining the accuracy of datasets that aim to predict summer precipitation based on spring surface temperature anomalies.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对维护旨在根据春季表面温度异常预测夏季降水的数据集的准确性所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges in maintaining accuracy include the need for robust land initialization and model configurations, as well as the difficulties in capturing the full extent of temperature anomalies. State-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) often struggle to preserve memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies, which can lead to underestimation of effects on precipitation. Additionally, model biases and deficiencies in parameterizations can affect the accuracy of predictions, as seen in the mismatch between observed and simulated anomalies in some regions.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 维护准确性面临的挑战包括需要强大的土地初始化和模型配置，以及捕捉温度异常的全面程度的困难。最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）通常难以保持从初始化的地表温度异常中获得的记忆，这可能导致对降水影响的低估。此外，模型偏差和参数化缺陷也会影响预测的准确性，正如在某些地区观察到的异常与模拟结果之间的不匹配所示。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore how land surface temperature and snowpack initialization techniques can be optimized to enhance atmospheric model accuracy for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨如何优化地表温度和雪盖初始化技术，以提高亚季节到季节预测的气象模型准确性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: In the LS4P project, an innovative approach to initializing land surface temperature (LST) and subsurface temperature (SUBT) over the Tibetan Plateau was developed to improve model accuracy. The method involved adjusting initial conditions based on each model's temperature bias and observed anomalies, which allowed models to better predict June precipitation over identified hotspots. The challenge lies in robust land initialization and model configuration due to significant errors in model parameterizations and reanalysis data.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在LS4P项目中，开发了一种创新的方法来初始化青藏高原的地表温度（LST）和地下温度（SUBT），以提高模型的准确性。该方法涉及根据每个模型的温度偏差和观测异常调整初始条件，使模型能够更好地预测识别出的热点地区的6月降水。挑战在于由于模型参数化和再分析数据中的显著误差，导致土地初始化和模型配置的稳健性问题。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please investigate the potential challenges in using ensemble-mean simulations to predict atmospheric circulations and precipitation anomalies, especially when compared to observed data.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请调查使用集合平均模拟预测大气环流和降水异常时可能面临的挑战，特别是与观测数据相比。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The LS4P project noted several challenges with ensemble-mean simulations, including discrepancies between simulated and observed wave trains, and the inability to capture observed temperature anomalies like the cold anomaly in May 2003 over the Tibetan Plateau. Model ensembles often exhibit faster evolved atmospheric responses than observations, leading to inconsistencies in Southern Hemispheric circulations and difficulties in accurately predicting regional precipitation differences.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: LS4P项目指出了集合均值模拟的几个挑战，包括模拟与观测波列之间的差异，以及无法捕捉到像2003年5月在青藏高原上出现的冷异常等观测温度异常。模型集合通常表现出比观测更快的气候响应，导致南半球环流的不一致性，并在准确预测区域降水差异方面面临困难。
